meanings.definition: To bring to a state of perfection
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, he finally consummated his masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: The chef consummated the dish with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent3: The artist's brushstrokes consummated the canvas into a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication and passion consummated in a flawless performance on stage.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting over the horizon consummated the picturesque view.

meanings.definition: To complete (a marriage) by sexual intercourse
meanings.sent1: The couple consummated their marriage on their honeymoon.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, it is traditional to consummate the marriage on the wedding night.
meanings.sent3: The newlyweds giggled nervously before consummating their union.
meanings.sent4: The wedding vows were just the beginning; they would consummate their love later that night.
meanings.sent5: The marriage was consummated with love, trust, and understanding.

meanings.sent1: The final piece of the puzzle consummated the whole picture.
meanings.sent2: The last chapter of the book consummated the story perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The last stroke of the brush consummated the artist's vision.
meanings.sent4: The handshake consummated the business deal between the two companies.
meanings.sent5: The last note of the symphony consummated the musical journey.
